description.text: #ylt#p#ygt# Before we start with more complex experiments, we show some other ways for loading your data. This experiment loads data of the widely used sparse data format known from Support Vector Machines. This format is especially useful for text data or other data where many attribute values are 0. #ylt#/p#ygt# #ylt#p#ygt# #ylt#ul#ygt# #ylt#li#ygt#When you change between expert and beginner mode you can see that the SparseFormatExampleSource uses many parameters. Please refer to the RapidMiner Tutorial for further explanations.#ylt#/li#ygt# #ylt#li#ygt# The operator reference chapter of the RapidMiner Tutorial offers a detailed description of all operators and their parameters. A very short description of an operator is delivered in an operator info dialog (from the context menu of an operator in tree view or by pressing F1). #ylt#table#ygt##ylt#tr#ygt##ylt#td#ygt##ylt#icon#ygt#24/information2#ylt#/icon#ygt##ylt#/td#ygt##ylt#td#ygt##ylt#i#ygt#Show some information about the selected operator.#ylt#/i#ygt##ylt#/td#ygt##ylt#/tr#ygt##ylt#/table#ygt# #ylt#/li#ygt# #ylt#li#ygt# Some informations about parameters appear as tool tip text when you hold the mouse pointer in a field of the property table.#ylt#/li#ygt# #ylt#/ul#ygt# #ylt#/p#ygt#
